title: Analyzing Adversary TTPs
description: A threat intelligence analyst is researching a specific adversary group to understand their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).

tasks.description: Gather all available reporting on the adversary group (e.g., APT28) from internal and external sources.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst successfully collects a corpus of reports on the target group.

tasks.description: Analyze the reports and map the group's observed behaviors to the MITRE ATT&CK framework.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst creates a detailed ATT&CK map showing the group's preferred TTPs.

tasks.description: Use the ATT&CK map to identify gaps in the company's own security controls and recommend improvements.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst uses the intelligence to provide actionable recommendations for improving defenses against that specific adversary.
